snippet: Sprint Nextel has secured control of Clearwire, the wireless network operator that holds valuable spectrum, according to a regulatory filing on Thursday.
abstract: Sprint Nextel has secured control of Clearwire, the wireless network operator that holds valuable spectrum, according to a regulatory filing on Thursday.

headline.main: Sprint Gains Greater Control of Clearwire
headline.print_headline: Sprint Is Said to Be Seeking More Control of Clearwire

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

snippet: If a gadget breaks, gets lost or is stolen, it makes sense to replace it. But deciding whether to abandon an older device that still works for a newer, shinier one is tougher.
abstract: Brian Lam Tool Kit column examines when and if it makes sense to upgrade and replace gadgets like smartphones and computers that are neither broken nor lost.

headline.main: Knowing When It Pays to Upgrade Your Gadgets
headline.print_headline: Knowing When It Pays To Upgrade Your Gadgets

snippet: Disney's Magic Kingdom will be dry no more, seven Manhattan hotel rooms for $150 more or less, financial survival in a time of fiscal peril and other consumer-focused news from The New York Times.
abstract: Disney's Magic Kingdom will be dry no more, seven Manhattan hotel rooms for $150 more or less, financial survival in a time of fiscal peril and other consumer-focused news from The New York Times.

headline.main: Wednesday Reading: The Magic Kingdom Will Be Dry No More

snippet: A founder of Alfa Development/Management comes from a Cuban-American family that has been involved in the real estate business since the 1970s.
abstract: Vivian Marino 30-Minute Interview with Alfa Development/Management founder and principal Michael Namer, who talks about how his Cuban-American family has been involved in the real estate business since the 1970s.
